# item

**Instance Property**

The pasteboard reader or writer object dependent on the context where you use the dragging item.

## Declaration

```swift
var item: Any { get }
```

## Discussion

When you create an `NSDraggingItem` instance, `item` is the `pasteboardWriter` passed to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/init(pasteboardWriter:)].

However, when enumerating dragging items using the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingSession] method [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingSession/enumerateDraggingItems(options:for:classes:searchOptions:using:)] or the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingInfo] method [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingInfo/enumerateDraggingItems(options:for:classes:searchOptions:using:)], `item` is not the original pasteboard reader or writer instance. It is an instance of one of the classes provided to the enumeration method’s `classArray` parameter.

## Drag image components

- **imageComponents**: An array of dragging image components to use to create the drag image.
- **imageComponentsProvider**: An array of blocks that provide the dragging image components.
- **NSDraggingItem.ImageComponentKey**: Keys that identify components of a dragging image.
